sub_title: Policy adviser and human development practitioner
summary:
Policy adviser and human development practitioner with fifteen years of experience, mainly in the sphere of international cooperation, committed to supporting the public management of complex systems.

Proficient analyst, knowledgeable about economics and governance, apt at translating politically-sensitive analysis into strategic guidance and policy formulation & implementation support, with exposure to several areas – agricultural & food systems, industry, trade, regional & rural development, natural resources, and climate change.

Experienced facilitator of multi-actor processes in culturally-diverse settings, capable of fostering knowledge exchange and uptake, organising quality, thorough dialogue, and brokering consensus.

Resourceful & result-oriented partner & team leader, able to steer collaborative undertakings, work in multidisciplinary teams, and efficiently deploy resources. Professional dedicated to the management & development of knowledge-intensive organisations.

company.name: European Centre for Development Policy Management (ECDPM)

profile_positions.description:
As part of the Learning and Quality unit, support the strategic management of the organisation – planning, implementation monitoring, outreach and impact management, learning, and liaison with institutional partners; coordinate efforts to strengthen the methodologies and develop skills underpinning the core functions of the Centre.

Act as Focal Point for policy coherence for sustainable development, providing methodological support to thematic work streams and partners for tackling complex, interconnected challenges and taking cross-sectoral approaches; facilitate a community of practice involving senior civil servants to improve policy coherence for development (PCD) and contribute to international processes promoting policy coherence in relation to sustainable development.

Lead and contribute to research, stakeholder engagement and advisory services in support of initiatives and processes to respond to risks linked to climate and environmental change; supported a strategic evaluation of the coherence of Dutch policies with regards to climate action, food security and water in developing countries; through the EU-funded project Cascading climate risks: Towards adaptive and resilient European societies (CASCADES), identify cross-border risks linked to climate change affecting European foreign, security and economic policy interests, and inform the formulation of mutually reinforcing policies for building resilience, notably at the nexus of development and security.

Take part in the African Union-European Union Relations work stream’s efforts to monitor progress in the Africa-EU Partnership, build a better understanding of African and European actors’ political priorities and of convergence and divergence points; support the Belgian Presidency of the EU in 2024 for deepening the dialogue and advancing the partnership in the area of health.
profile_positions.title: Policy Officer – Policy coherence & EU-Africa cooperation

profile_positions.description:
Contributed to policy processes for the development of inclusive and resilient agri-food markets and for regional trade facilitation, as part of regional food security and economic development strategies in sub-Saharan Africa (ECOWAS, EAC & COMESA); supported innovative modes of economic cooperation between Europe and Africa.

Delivered timely, politically-sensitive insights into regional trade and value chain development dynamics, national policies and regional agreements; in partnership with African knowledge institutes, facilitated policy dialogues amongst public actors, farmers organisations, trade associations, business executives and experts, with a view to jointly promoting policy change, regulatory and fiscal reforms, and coordinated investments in productive capabilities, agro-logistics and rural and cross-border infrastructure (e.g., rice sector in West Africa); advised and assisted European development partners and multilateral organisations in designing and implementing programmes supporting regional strategies and action plans and improving market access for smallholder farmers and SMEs in West and Eastern Africa.

Managed a work programme and a budget, leading and contributing to fundraising efforts (e.g., team leader for a €235,000 grant). Supervised and mentored junior staff.

Carried out research and outreach on policy coherence, with a focus on policy interlinkages between trade, investment, and food security; developed concepts, tools, and evidence (e.g., country-specific assessments of policy coherence for development) and participated in various fora in Europe and internationally (e.g., events at the UN high-level political forum on sustainable development) to support the operationalisation of policy coherence.
profile_positions.title: Policy Officer – Economic and agricultural transformation

profile_positions.description: Designed and coordinated an assessment of interventions by the USAID West Bank and Gaza Trade Facilitation project for trade and people movement facilitation between the West Bank and Israel; designed surveys of economic operators and touristic users; led a team of analysts and enumerators administering surveys and collecting data; analysed the effects of trade facilitation measures on cross-border trade flows and Palestinian private sector development; provided recommendations to further ease constraints to trade and business growth.
profile_positions.title: Economic development consultant

profile_positions.company: Famine Early Warning Systems Network (FEWS NET)
profile_positions.description:
Led activities in the Markets and Trade thematic area; developed a knowledge base on linkages between agri-food markets, socio-economic conditions and food security; a database; analytical tools; and a reporting process (FEWS NET Price Watch) in support of food security analysis, early warning of food crises and decision-making; delivered timely market and policy analyses during major food and humanitarian crises linked to climatic shocks and conflicts (2010–11 international food price crisis, 2011 Horn of Africa crisis, 2009–10 and 2011–12 West Africa crises) to support US government humanitarian assistance planning, contributing to sizable efficiency gains in food aid delivery and mitigation of adverse effects on local markets.

Conducted special projects, e.g., study of regional wheat markets to strengthen food security monitoring, early warning and scenario-building capacities in Afghanistan and Tajikistan and allowed for leaner and better targeted emergency food assistance operations; research on El Niño-Southern Oscillation’s impact on staple food prices in Eastern and Southern Africa; and the development of regional food price indices as a tool for global early warning.

Provided technical guidance and assistance and quality assurance to country and regional staff for market analysis and monitoring; contributed to capacity building activities for local FEWS NET staff and their governmental and civil society partners; helped strengthen collaboration with US agencies (NASA, USDA) and international organisations (FAO, OECD, World Bank, WFP) involved in food security monitoring and early warning; contributed to budgeting, work planning and quarterly reporting tasks; recruited and supervised junior staff.
profile_positions.title: Markets and Trade Advisor – Chemonics International & Michigan State University

profile_positions.company: Famine Early Warning Systems Network (FEWS NET)
profile_positions.description:
Delivered regular analyses of trends in staple food commodity markets to monitor food security conditions in Africa, Central America, Central Asia and globally; contributed to the development of a scenario-building method to project food insecurity and emergency food assistance needs and inform contingency humanitarian assistance plans;

Helped set up a monitoring system for informal cross-border agricultural and livestock trade in Eastern Africa; managed a study of vulnerable households’ participation in market-based, income-generating activities in the Limpopo River basin in Mozambique to support the USAID Mozambique office in designing an economic development programme.
profile_positions.title: Markets and Trade Specialist

Delivered timely analyses of food security conditions to inform food assistance planning and recovery efforts in affected areas; liaised with the USAID Haiti office, the Government of Haiti, UN agencies and NGOs to exchange information and contribute to post-disaster needs assessments and assistance plans.
